definition: to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: In his adolescence, he had apparent abundant affiance.
sentences.chinese: 他在青少年时期就显得很有长进。

sentences.english: Of course, one can still advance in Dhyana through familiarity with this kind of rituals.
sentences.chinese: 当然，行者也可以经由熟悉此类的仪轨而在定上长进。

sentences.english: If you decide to use subtitles anyway, don’t blame me for your lack of progress
sentences.chinese: 如果你还是要使用字幕i，没长进可别怪我。

sentences.english: This is a man who has learned in every date he has been in in the last year-and-a-half.
sentences.chinese: 这个人在这一年半来的每一天，都在学习长进。

sentences.english: The good thing is, he has made great progress in cooking.
sentences.chinese: 好在他现在厨艺大有长进。

sentences.english: As long as you keep practing, you will improve.
sentences.chinese: 只要你一直练习，技术就会有长进。

sentences.english: If it was too easy, it wouldn’t help you grow.
sentences.chinese: 如果太简单了，你就不可能有所长进。

sentences.english: People do not work for nothing, people do not learn no progress.
sentences.chinese: 人不劳动没出息，人不学习没长进。

sentences.english: You won't make any progress if you don't exert yourself a bit more.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不多用点功，你就不会有长进。

sentences.english: In order to grow in grace, we must be much alone.
sentences.chinese: 我们如果要在恩典上长进，必须多有单独的时候。

sentences.english: Unpromising people do not work; people do not study and did not progress.
sentences.chinese: 人不劳动没出息，人不学习没长进。

sentences.english: Have we learned nothing from the financial crisis of the past two years?
sentences.chinese: 经历了过去两年的金融危机之后，我们是否毫无长进？

sentences.english: Being not satisfied will push me to grow.
I just don’t feel like I am making any progress.
sentences.chinese: 我只是觉得自己毫无长进。

definition: to forge ahead vigorously/to dedicate oneself to progress
diligent/industrious (in one's studies)/to study hard/to make great effort
a turn for the better/to pick up/to improve
the young will be redoubtable in the years to come (idiom)/the younger generations will surpass us in time
